docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners of Health met again yesterday at the Mayor's office. The bark J. H. Kent, from Ponce, P. R.; bark C, S. Fletcher, from Sagua la Grande, Cuba; sehooner Medora, from Jacme, St. Domingo; bark Louisa, from Rio Janeiro, via Bermuda; and steamship Quaker, City, from Havana, were all ordered to be cleansed and fumigated, and to be then allowed to come to the City at the discreation of the Health Officer.

headline.main: From a German to the Germaes.

docs.lead_paragraph: FREDERIOK HECKER, the German Republican, who is one of the Fremont and Dayton electors at large for the State of Illinois, was invited to address the Republican mass meeting at Belleville, but was prevented by an attack of erysipelas, from which he is now recovering. The following letter from him, was read to the meeting:

headline.main: Another Suicide of a Young Girl at Albany--and All for Love

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday morning Coroner WHITNEY was called upon to hold an inquest over the remains of on CATHERINE HOGAN, who died suddenly about 8 A. M., at the house of Mr. HENDY. No. 31 Water-street. The testimony adduced before his Jury showed, that the deceased had come to this city from Troy, Friday last--that, she was of robust health, though apparently suffering somewhat from depressed sprits;

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Fire in Forty-fifth-street--Nearly $100,000 Worth of Property Destroyed. Board of Governors. Commissioners of Health. That Flag. The Mayoralty. The Naked Bathing Nuisance. Phenomena of the Heated Term.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Governors met yesterday at the Penitentiary. The usual requisitions were read and passed without more than occasional and unimportant comment.
docs.snippet: The Board of Governors met yesterday at the Penitentiary. The usual requisitions were read and passed without more than occasional and unimportant comment.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Commissioners of Health. A Transparent Ballot-Box. POLICE INTELLIGENCE. The Broadway Murder--No Clue to the Murderer--Continuation of the Coroner's Inquest. School Receptions. Installation in the Laight-street Baptist Church. Free Academy Admissions. UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT--JULY 19. Miscellaneous. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT--JULY 21. Sentence of the Second Mate of the Braman.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Health Commissioners met yesterday at 12 o'clock M., at the City Hall, the President, ISAAC O. BARKER, Esq., in the Chair, and WALTER F. CONCKLIN, Secretary. The following decisions were made as to the disposition of vessels just arrived at Quarantine: To be allowed to come on to the City after being the-roughly cleansed and ventilated:
